alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Houston; Polk; Trinity; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 27 at 11:11PM CDT until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Neches River Near Diboll affecting Tyler, Trinity, Polk, Houston and Angelina Counties. For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto, Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neches River Near Diboll. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of boat ramps, paths, and trails. Move livestock and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 11.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage late tonight to 13.2 feet Saturday evening. It will fall to 12.4 feet Tuesday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 04/28/1964. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Friday evening at 1115 PM CDT.
